users.name: Coal Authority
users.description: We manage the effects of historical coal mining. You can report a hazard 24/7 on 01623 646 333. This account is monitored Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm, excl bank holidays.

tweets.text: Swindale beck was hooching with #salmon today. Great to see this pair guarding their redd. @EnvAgencyNW @RSPBEngland @unitedutilities @WildHaweswater https://t.co/1ERd6KHtzX

@leeinthelakes @EnvAgencyNW @RSPBEngland @unitedutilities @WildHaweswater Brilliant news from Swindale Beck. Totally vindicates all of the naturalisation work conducted on the river and floodplain. Well done to  all involved.
@leeinthelakes @EnvAgencyNW @RSPBEngland @unitedutilities @WildHaweswater Fantastic footage - what clear water...

üö® We need YOUR help in deciding the winner & two runners up from our annual employee Nature Focus photograph competition! üö® 

This year‚Äôs theme is pollinators! 

It‚Äôs been a tough job shortlisting the snaps to six & we want you to decide your top three (..Answers in comments)üíô https://t.co/FOINqBMbX4

Fantastic news for the upper Aire. Combined with more modest efforts @LothersdaleWG and sterling work on Upper Aire Project from @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @YorksFarmWild & @WildTroutTrust, should see knock-on impacts ameliorating flood peaks #slowtheflow and improved habitat https://t.co/aTt611uYqa

The Fairhaven to Church Scar Coastal Protection Scheme on the Fylde coast will protect 2,400 properties ‚Äì find out more about the project in the new edition of #CurrentMagazine16 üëâ https://t.co/l0QFGnuN7T

Very exciting project - great news during #nationaltreeweek. We look forward to supporting the natural flood management #nfm intiatives on this site https://t.co/BdzFSa1i4g

It's little things that make our collective efforts worthwhile.
Spur us on to achieve more.

The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x

tweets.text:
Enjoy your #weekend walk on the #ThamesPath and take an extra bag for your sweet wrappers, cans and take-away cups to recycle at home. Anything you drop on the Path can end up in the water, pollute the River Thames, and be a danger to wildlife. 
@EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust https://t.co/E30bfiBYkE

tweets.text:
Great news - our plans to improve flood defences in York‚Äôs Museum Gardens have been approved by @CityofYork today.

This will better protect 42 homes & 15 businesses within Marygate & make the city more resilient to #climatechange #YorkFAS #floodrisk

https://t.co/UXWwWZat6E https://t.co/Z6KG2URBFB

@CleanUpTadworth @JSHKT20 @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum @EnvAgencySE Good afternoon. The report will now go through to the relevant team for them to look into. Many Thanks, Johanne.

@reigatebanstead @JSHKT20 @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum @EnvAgencySE So have we done enough to highlight this to you now. I‚Äôve also reported via your website link

tweets.text: Superb @CommonsEFRA session with @EnvAgency on #flooding this afternoon. @DefraGovUK have published their new #floodplan today & we will continue to scrutinise govt. policy in this area for all those affected by flooding! https://t.co/Nf2aen6Cal

@CleanUpTadworth @JSHKT20 @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum @EnvAgencySE If a fly-tip is off the public footpath, then it's the responsibility of the landowner to clear it. They can be issued with a Community Protection Notice ordering them to do so. Such instances need to be reported to us and we'll then deal with them accordingly. Thanks. Shaun. 2/2

@CleanUpTadworth @JSHKT20 @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum @EnvAgencySE Hello. On private land with a right of way through it, such as Sandlands Grove (which is a byway), it is the responsibility of the local authority to clear any instances of fly-tipping, as long as it is actually on that right of way. 1/2

In light of the #SpendingReview and with less than a week to go, our Challenge '21 event is taking place next week, with some of the most influential voices in #infrastructure.

@CECASouthWest, @SomersetCouncil , @CBItweets, @EnvAgency, @DorsetCouncilUK  @ICESouthWest https://t.co/sG82J2rDUf

'Raw sewage dumped into English & Welsh beaches '2,900 times this year'

More shocking findings from @sascampaigns. Allowing water companies to pollute public beaches is a failure of regulation @EnvAgency that's encouraged by @UKGov funding cuts.

https://t.co/xypClFJ96s https://t.co/3f867xM3XV

We're welcoming more people to the countryside than ever, it's brilliant that so many of us are enjoying the health and wellbeing benefits of time in nature, but please remember to take your rubbish home with you. Thank you. https://t.co/Iu4v6Fc9l0

Amazing news for Greater Manchester from @MerseyRivers! 

An otter on the banks of the River Irwell in Salford - all down to the fantastic work of environmental projects across our city region üëè

#GMGreenCity @natural_course @greatermcr @EnvAgencyNW @unitedutilities @NENorthWest https://t.co/OqthUBWxO9

We are delighted to have added two new talks to PiXL Stretch on microplastic pollution from the @EnvAgency.

At a time when this issue has never been more important to understand, we hope you might like to share these with students. 

Launch PiXL Stretch: https://t.co/B4XD9ImZiS https://t.co/lpkzmcCTWi

At a time when this issue has never been more important to understand, we hope you might like to share these with students. 

Launch PiXL Stretch: https://t.co/B4XD9ImZiS https://t.co/lpkzmcCTWi

Some great partnership working between our Flood and Coastal Risk Management Team and consultants @MalcolmHughesUK today. 

They've been taking imagery at Sale Water Park to help our resilience and response during a #flood https://t.co/gcISuY82hl

tweets.text: The infilling of West Waterloo Dock was ruled to be wrong in 2006 - and is WRONG now https://t.co/4ZSq6Wql97 @KimJohnsonMP @cllrkemp @CllrNickSmall @CllrKennedy @meaglemp @IanByrneMP @DanCardenMP @EnvAgencyNW @ELF_Law @SAVEBrit @HistoricEngland @EuropaNostraUk @thevicsoc @UNESCO
We‚Äôre looking forward to welcome new students to work with us and our interdisciplinary research teams at @BIFoRUoB @drjoshlarsen @EnvAgency @BritGeoSurvey @metoffice https://t.co/k45bzbWppS

An angler has been found guilty of fishing without permission on the Norfolk broads. 

The 69-year-old has been ordered to pay ¬£641.

Read more: https://t.co/cI3Fcj8hpg 

Purchase a fishing licence here: https://t.co/EL8RJbzYS0 @NorfolkPolice @BroadsBeat #Norfolk #Fishing https://t.co/ENKwrmcNbw

@JSHKT20 @reigatebanstead @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum @EnvAgencySE It‚Äôs not a blockage as it‚Äôs a wide path / lane. But it is full of old historical fly tips surely it shouldn‚Äôt just be left there even if it is to the side, especially as it is a public footpath
 @T66018937R @reigatebanstead @WaltonForum  @TadworthWalton
You'll get to work with @drjoshlarsen @stefankrauseh2o and a great team of co investigators including the @EnvAgency  @BritGeoSurvey @metoffice and more international collaborators

@CleanUpTadworth @reigatebanstead @TadworthWalton @george_curry @RBBCLeader @LDPromos @Ju_Qu @GoddenAlison @T66018937R @DavidBinns7 @TBotting @SurreyWT @BritishHorse @carolinempepper @thankyou @WaltonForum Once the flytipping is on private land it gets complicated, as there is a legal responsibility to remove dangerous waste, and thats where @EnvAgencySE come in. If its a blockage of Public Footpaths/Rights of Way locally, let me know and I‚Äôll see who‚Äôs best to deal..

tweets.text: I caught up with the @EnvAgencyNW and @VolkerStevinUK  team about the progress that is being made with the #Egremont flood risk management scheme, which included some drone footage - below - where you can see the extent of the water storage being engineered #partnership https://t.co/HvjSmgfQ3H

New #PhDopportunity FORESTS OF THE FUTURE: WHAT, WHEN AND HOW WILL TREES GET THEIR WATER? https://t.co/OkU9HlQDLz  Investigate how trees will use water in the future using unique forest experimental facility.

We've just provided updates to some of the information for the Padiham Flood Risk Management Scheme on @TheFloodHub website. In a world where face-to-face contact is unfortunately limited, keep this link bookmarked for all flood defence updates at https://t.co/03YhypBvzp https://t.co/ceZaSxELDC

Government and water industry regulators have written to water companies in England today to outline the next steps for their plans to support a green economic recovery. 

Find out more here üëá https://t.co/Z8Lt6yqfvP

Fascinating morning for Day 3 of the 22nd International #CBRNSymposium2020. The theme was Recovery with speakers from @DefraGovUK, @PHE_uk and the @EnvAgency, and Fukoshima as a case study. Thanks also to  today's sposnor @CBAssocsLtd https://t.co/i2zV40EFdi

We are preparing for the Anniversary of Storm Desmond 

Here we are with @ITVborder on one of our Natural Flood Management projects to highlight our work on Slowing the Flow & creating a better prepared nation

Catch the full story on ITV throughout next week & the week after. https://t.co/7leJZmu083

#Pollution that enters the river in the #Pennines washes all the way downstream to #Tynemouth.Our log barriers are doing a great job stabilising this spoil heap. They blend into the landscape&stop toxic chemicals from metal mining moving downstream @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority https://t.co/1egDSBYkx5

So exciting to see the amazing progress on the @SevernUnlocked  fish pass at Diglis. It's looking fantastic and not too far off now. The viewing gallery space is brilliant and the team are doing an incredible job @LIFEprogramme @CRTWalesandSW @HeritageFundWM https://t.co/qkQaKc6xcR

tweets.text:
Groundwater flooding can occur days or even weeks after rain. As the water table rises, springs can appear and floodwater can rise from beneath the ground. Find out if you are at risk, sign up to #groundwaterfloodalerts and be prepared. #floodaware 
https://t.co/LpngHvk28Z https://t.co/5fkzwMAowG
